examples: There shall be asylum for habitual teetotaler,but they will probably relapse into teetotalism as soon as they come out.

chineseMeaning: adj. 上升的;有优势的; n. 运星;祖宗;  =ascendent.;
examples: After the election, our political party was once again in the ascendant.
We still have the ascendant position in world politics.
Though he is still a young man his political career is already in the ascendant.

chineseMeaning: adj. 无菌的;防感染的;冷漠的; n. 防腐剂;
examples: Sterile equipment and aseptic sampling techniques shall be used when necessary.
She gave me an aseptic smile.

chineseMeaning: n. 方面;方位;外观;外貌;
examples: This is only one aspect of the problem.
He has made progress in every aspect.
The building has a southern aspect.
The open spaces differ according to aspect.
His brother is a man with a serious aspect.
The fierce aspect of the salesman frightened the customer off.
Blight is a disease incident to plants.
The apple crop was wiped out by blight.
The accident cast a blight on our happiness.
Such a blight was fallen over my literary career.

chineseMeaning: adj. 快乐的;无忧无虑的;轻率的;
examples: She seems quite blithe.
Sunday's child is bonny, blithe, good and gay.
Though we had never done it, as blithe and hardworking spirits we felt that we could too.

chineseMeaning: v. 部署;展开;进入战斗位置;配置;
examples: Artillery was deployed in the west.
It has been designed to be extremely easy to deploy.
It is a job in which a variety of professional skills will be deployed.
The infantry began to deploy at dawn.
We should deploy our resources effectively.
The head of state was deposed by the army.
The council of the tribe also had the power to depose both sachems and chiefs.
A witness must depose to such facts as are within his own knowledge.
Investigators will depose the witness behind closed doors.

chineseMeaning: n. 堕落;腐败;邪恶;堕落的行为;
examples: Experiencing life does not mean depravity and indulgence.
Awe is an essential force to restrain depravity.
If you neglect this property, it will depreciate.
New cars start to depreciate as soon as they are on the road.
It's impolite to gibe at a foreign student's English.
If we substitute the idea of respect for the audience, the gibe is turned against the player.
The setting sun gilds the sky.
Her beauty gilds her vice.
For such a beautiful girl, to use make-up would be to gild the lily.
There was raw glaze on the pots that sat again on the drying rack.
Tang three-color glaze horses are famous for their perfect design and realism.

chineseMeaning: adj. 抒情的 抒情诗
examples: The anthology reveals a prejudice in favour of lyric poets.
His earlier work announced a lyric talent of the first order.
The maelstrom sucked in the canoe.
They were being sucked into the maelstrom of war.
She was drawn into a maelstrom of revolutionary events.

chineseMeaning: v. 夷为平地;摧毁;消除;抹去;
examples: The city was razed by an earthquake.
The troops attacked his village and razed it to the ground.

chineseMeaning: n.大量的纸;大量的字; v. 扩展;扩大
examples: Steeped in new moods and ideas, I bought a ream of paper and tried to write.
He writes reams of verse.
The police reassured her about the child's safety.
We went to the hospital to reassure ourselves about his condition.
The manager tried to reassure her that she will not lose her job.
A glance in the mirror reassured him that his tie wasn't crooked.
Let me reassure you (that) your service is quite satisfying.
This seemed to reassure him and he continued more confidently.
Raising a creative child can be taxing.
History is the most telling witness.
A more telling criticism is that he reduces ethics to interpersonal relationships.

chineseMeaning: adj. 温和的;适度的;有节制的;
examples: I love the temperate climate here.
It is rare for so temperate a man to get angry.
And he is steeped through and through with profound yet temperate happiness.
He is a temperate man, and never drinks too much.
Its beauty is more a kind of smiling beauty and the happiness it gives us is mild and temperate.
The police obtained a search warrant for his house.
Have you got a warrant of fitness for your car?
You shouldn't arrest him without warrant.
He had no warrant for his suspicion.
Blobs of wax covered the candlestick.
He is modeling a unicorn in wax .
They bought wax and honey up by the great.

chineseMeaning: n. 混乱;次重量级的摔跤手; v. 翻滚;沉迷;混乱;
examples: I have just cleared up a bewildering welter of data saved in my computer.
